definition[0]: to move closer to someone or something, especially in order to attack them
example[0]: The snake closed in for the kill.
example[1]: enemy soldiers closing in on them from all sides
definition[1]: if the night, bad weather etc closes in, it becomes darker or gets worse
example[2]: The sun had set and dusk was closing in.
definition[2]: if the days close in, they become shorter because it is autumn
